hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC 20-day realized volatility compresses below 35% while the 5-day average daily range falls under 2.5%, a breakout above the 20-day high + 0.5% triggers a regime transition to BULL with high probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility in neutral markets often precede directional regime shifts. The compression indicates pent-up energy, and a clean breakout suggests institutional accumulation or macro catalyst absorption. The +0.5% buffer filters false breakouts.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 20-day high + 0.5% threshold

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry OR regime classification changes to BULL with confidence > 70%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain (close back below 20-day high within 3 days) OR lead to BEAR regime instead of BULL within 10 trading sessions.
